newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Greece's Intracom to modernise Bulgarian lottery.
newsitem.headline: Greece's Intracom to modernise Bulgarian lottery.

text.p: Bulgaria's sports lottery operator and Greece's Intracom group said on Monday they had sealed a deal to introduce modern technology into the Bulgarian game, ending a long-running battle between the two firms.

"The agreement envisages the implementation of one of the most modern technologies, using On-Line Systems comparable to those used in Europe and the United States for organising games based on chance," said the joint statement.
It said the project, to be financed by Intracom, was the biggest investment in the field of information technology in Bulgaria in recent years, with investment totalling more than $40 million.
The statement said the project guaranteed a big growth in the revenues of the Bulgarian Sports Totalisator (lottery), which help fund Bulgarian sport.

It also said Intracom would not implement the decision of the International Arbitrage Court in Paris, which last year ruled that the Bulgarian lottery should pay the Greek grouping $10 million for cancellation of an earlier contract.
A Bulgarian court is due to rule on the Paris court's decision this Wednesday.

The lottery, which runs a number-forecasting game and also tries to forecast the results of Britain's premier division soccer games, is very popular in Bulgaria. It has thousands of betting shops across the country.
Bulgaria's prominent coach in artistic gymnastics Neshka Robeva has launched a campaign against the new agreement with Intracom, saying it threatens the funding of Bulgarian sport.
